text: If you get an error message in jupyter saying something about "No ``benchmark_spec`` was provided...". Just add "--no-benchmark" to the end of the last cell, making it "%zipline --bundle quantopian-quandl --start 2008-1-1 --end 2012-1-1 --output strat.pickle --no-benchmark"

author: @gustavorabino9353
text: @sentdex Zipline is broken.  I have to workaround a lot of errors just to install zipline including creating a whole new environment to be able to run and now I get an error while running:  %zipline --bundle quantopian-quandl --start 2017-1-1 --end 2018-1-1 -o strat.pickle  JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0).  I followed the suggestions on this issue:  https://github.com/quantopian/zipline/issues/2480   The solution is to manually edit two files inside zipline/data/ folder:  1) The first file is benchmark.py , replace its contents with:   import numpy as np import pandas as pd import pandas_datareader.data as pd_reader  def get_benchmark_returns(symbol, first_date, last_date):      """     Get a Series of benchmark returns from Yahoo associated with `symbol`.     Default is `SPY`.     Parameters     ----------     symbol : str          Benchmark symbol for which we're getting the returns.   The data is provided by Yahoo Finance     """     data = pd_reader.DataReader(         symbol,         'yahoo',         first_date,         last_date     )     data = data['Close']     data[pd.Timestamp('2008-12-15')] = np.nan     data[pd.Timestamp('2009-08-11')] = np.nan     data[pd.Timestamp('2012-02-02')] = np.nan     data = data.fillna(method='ffill')     return data.sort_index().tz_localize('UTC').pct_change(1).iloc[1:]   2) The second file is loader.py. Inside the file we have to find the line ''get_benchmark_returns(symbol)'' and change it to ''get_benchmark_returns(symbol,first_date, last_date)''  Could you add this to the desc in a link?

author: @peterblair9822
text: I HIGHLY recommend installing zipline with a conda env (venv was a nightmare for osx/ubuntu). If you have anaconda3 installed, directions are as follows:  conda create -n [name of your new environment] python=3.5 conda source activate [insert conda env name] conda install -c Quantopian zipline  Game. Set. Match. You're finished.

author: @xilin1063
text: For those encounter the error " line 1 column 1 (char 0) ",here's the suggestion comes from https://github.com/quantopian/zipline/issues/2480  by shlomikushchi: first,find zipline/data/benchmark.py , replace its contents with:   import numpy as np import pandas as pd import pandas_datareader.data as pd_reader  def get_benchmark_returns(symbol, first_date, last_date):     """     Get a Series of benchmark returns from Yahoo associated with `symbol`.     Default is `SPY`.      Parameters     ----------     symbol : str         Benchmark symbol for which we're getting the returns.      The data is provided by Yahoo Finance     """     data = pd_reader.DataReader(         symbol,         'yahoo',         first_date,         last_date     )      data = data['Close']      data[pd.Timestamp('2008-12-15')] = np.nan     data[pd.Timestamp('2009-08-11')] = np.nan     data[pd.Timestamp('2012-02-02')] = np.nan      data = data.fillna(method='ffill')      return data.sort_index().tz_localize('UTC').pct_change(1).iloc[1:]   then,find loader.py in the same folder, change get_benchmark_returns(symbol) into get_benchmark_returns(symbol,first_date, last_date),done!  reset your cmd to enter jupyter notebook, and you can run smoothly!
